network

Class NetworkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.NetworkManager

  • public class NetworkManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    7-4-15 Class for managing with the ad-hoc network.
    Author:
    Gerben Meijer

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkManager

        public NetworkManager(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a NetworkManager

        Initializes the network manager. - Sets the multicast group address - Sets up the multicast group socket via the multicast group port - Sets the Protocol.CLIENT_ID - Joins the multicast group and sets up its handlers

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(Packet packet)
        Sends a packet via the broadcast socket
        Parameters:
        packet - Packet to be send.

      • getClientId

        private int getClientId()
                 throws ClientIdNotAvailableException
        Returns the client id, taken from the ip address

        Builds an Enumeration of all NetworkInterfaces, checks their ip for the local address. The last number of the local address is your ID.

        Returns:
        client id
        Throws:
        ClientIdNotAvailableException - when no Id could be generated and causes the process to terminate with error code -1

      • putTableEntry

        public void putTableEntry(byte[] entry)
        Puts a routingEntry into the routingTable

        This method adds or sets the given entry to the routingTable If this destination does not exist yet, it will be added If this destination does exist, it will be updated, as well as the connectedClients list (and the pings missed).

        Parameters:
        entry - Entry to be put in the routingTable.
        See Also:
        Protocol Design

      • getTableEntryByDestination

        public byte[] getTableEntryByDestination(byte destination)
        Checks if the destination is in the routingTable and returns the entry if the destination is in the routingTable.

        Loops over the routingTable for the entry which matches the given destination Gives the byte[destination, cost, next_hop] where the match occurs

        Parameters:
        destination - The destination to be checked.
        Returns:
        The routingTable entry if contains the destination

      • getTableIndexByDestination

        public int getTableIndexByDestination(byte destination)
        Gives the index where this destination occurs, it it occurs.

        Loops over the routingTable for the entry which matches the given destination Gives the index of this entry

        Parameters:
        destination - destination to be checked.
        Returns:
        index of the entry in the routingTable.

      • dropTable

        public void dropTable()
        Clears the routingTable and re-initializes it

        clears the routingTable and adds the routingEntry to this client

      • sendTable

        public void sendTable()
        Broadcasts a Protocol.DISCOVERY_PACKET

        Constructs a Protocol.DISCOVERY_PACKET type packet that broadcasts the current routingTable

      • nextSequenceNum

        public int nextSequenceNum()
        Increments the sequenceNumber and returns the new sequence-number.

        Increments the sequenceNumber with one, and prints the old sequenceNumber to the standard out and returns the new sequenceNumber

        Returns:
        The new sequence-number.

        public long getLastTableDrop()
        Gets the time of the last time that the routingTable has been dropped in millis and as a long.
        Returns:
        Time of the last routingTableDrop.

      • constructPacket

        public Packet constructPacket(byte destination,
                     byte dataType,
                     byte[] data)
        Constructs a packet with given variables

        A more detailed version of the Packet constructor

        Parameters:
        destination - byte destination for this packets, as a Protocol.CLIENT_ID
        dataType - byte represents the type of packet
        data - byte[] the data of the packet.
        Returns:
        The constructed packet.

      • constructACK

        public Packet constructACK(Packet packet)
                    throws InvalidPacketException
        Constructs a Acknowledgement packet

        Uses Packet() to make a default packet, then adding/replacing custom elements. Destination will be the source of the packet parameter and the Data and Packet type will be set accordingly to our protocol design Also the Ack flag will be set and an empty data field will be supplied.

        Parameters:
        packet - That packet that will be used to construct an acknowledgement (also that packet that will be acknowledged)
        Returns:
        The constructed packet.
        Throws:
        InvalidPacketException - if a malformed packet is used for construction

      • constructPing

        public Packet constructPing()
        Constructs a broadcast Ping packet

        Uses constructPacket() to make a broadcasted ping packet. Difference being: Destination 0 and Protocol.dataType.PING. A name specified by clientName.

        Returns:
        packet a ping Packet with a destination 0
        See Also:
        constructPacket()

      • getConnectedClients

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.Byte,java.lang.Byte> getConnectedClients()
        Gets all connected clients as a ConcurrentHashMap.
        Returns:
        All connected clients.

      • increasePingRound

        public void increasePingRound()
        Increases the pings missed in the connectedClients map

        Increases the pings missed on every entry in the connectedClients Map and resets DVR if changes have occurred. Method will mostly be called on every ping interval to increase the pings missed Every time a ping comes in or a new discovery packet comes in, the pings missed for that client will be reset.

        See Also:
        Protocol.PING_INTERVAL

      • shouldBeExcluded

        private boolean shouldBeExcluded(byte[] entry)
        Method for excluding clients. Is used for manually send packets to a destination via another client. Returns true if
        Parameters:
        entry - The routingTableEntry which might be excluded.
        Returns:
        True if the entry corresponds to one of the clients who have to be excluded.
